title: Risk Evaluation and Education for Alzheimer's Disease (REVEAL) IV
description_brief: This study is intended to examine the impact of receiving a genetic risk assessment for Alzheimer's disease (AD) among individuals with Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI).
description_detailed:
Alzheimer's disease is a common condition affecting memory and thinking. Genes can sometimes be used to provide risk estimates for the eventual development of certain common diseases. Apolipoprotein E (APOE) is one gene which can provide information about a person's chances of developing Alzheimer's disease.

Some people with a diagnosis of Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI) are curious to learn more about the chance of developing Alzheimer's disease. In the REVEAL IV Study, we are examining the psychological and behavioral impact of learning genetic risk information pertaining to the chance for an individual with MCI to progress to dementia of the Alzheimer's type within three years.

Participation in this study requires an initial phone call which will elicit some demographic information about the participant and his or her study partner. A first in-person visit to the research clinic will consist of an education session, the administration of knowledge and attitudinal surveys and some tests to assess memory and thinking skills. This visit will take approximately 2-3 hours. Participants with MCI will have their blood drawn for genetic testing. Participants will then be randomized to one of two groups. Those in the intervention arm will receive a three-year risk estimate for the chance of progressing to dementia of the Alzheimer's type based on age, the diagnosis of MCI and their own APOE gene test result. Those in the comparison arm will receive a three-year risk estimate for the chance of progressing to dementia of the Alzheimer's type based on age and the diagnosis of MCI, without the APOE gene test result. Participants randomized to the comparison arm will have the opportunity to learn their own APOE gene test result at the end of the study. Participants and their study partners will be followed for 6 months following disclosure of results with 1 additional clinic visit and 1 additional phone interviews.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails:
32 enrolled participants were not assigned for the reasons that follow:

Ineligible (n=7)

* No study partner: 5
* Diagnosis was not amnestic mild cognitive impairment (MCI): 1
* Low cognitive score: 1

Declined to continue (n=17)

* No longer interested: n=11
* Too busy: 4
* No reason given: 2

Lost to follow-up (n=8)

groups.title: Apolipoprotein E (APOE) Genotype Non-Disclosure
groups.description:
Subjects will receive Alzheimer's disease risk disclosure. This assessment is based on age and MCI status alone.

Alzheimer's disease risk disclosure: Subjects with MCI will learn a three-year numerical risk estimate for the chance of progressing to dementia of the Alzheimer's type.

groups.title: Apolipoprotein E (APOE) Genotype Disclosure
groups.description:
Subjects will receive both APOE genotype and Alzheimer's disease risk disclosure. The assessment is based on age, MCI status, and genotype.

APOE genotype and Alzheimer's disease risk disclosure: Subjects with MCI will learn their own APOE genotype and a three-year numerical risk estimate for the chance of progressing to dementia of the Alzheimer's type.

groups.title: Total
groups.description: Total of all reporting groups

categories.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcomeMeasures.title: Geriatric Depression Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: A 15-item self-report assessment used to identify depression in the elderly. GDS scores ranged from 0-15. Higher scores indicated greater depression.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Participants who completed the full 15-item scale.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, 6 weeks post-disclosure, and 6 months post-disclosure

outcomeMeasures.title: Mini State Trait Anxiety Inventory
outcomeMeasures.description: Validated introspective psychological inventory consisting of 6 self-report items pertaining to anxiety affect. Responses are transformed into scores that range from 20 to 80, with higher scores indicating greater anxiety.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Participants who completed the full 6-item scale
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, 6 weeks post-disclosure, and 6 months post-disclosure

groups.title: APOE Genotype Non-Disclosure

outcomeMeasures.title: Impact of Event Scale (IES)
outcomeMeasures.description: The Impact of Event assesses intrusive thoughts and avoidance related to a specific stressful life event. It is a 15-item self-report measure with scores that range from 0 to 75, with greater scores indicating greater distress about the event.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Participants who completed the full 15-item scale.

groups.title: APOE Genotype Non-Disclosure

outcomeMeasures.title: Psychological Impact of Test Disclosure (IGT-AD)
outcomeMeasures.description: A 15-item scale measuring distress specific to the test results received. Scores range from 0-75, with higher scores indicating greater test-related distress. Higher scores indicate greater distress about the risk assessment.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Participants who completed the full 15-item scale

outcomeMeasures.title: Recall and Comprehension of Risk Information
outcomeMeasures.description: Several measures to assess participant recall and comprehension of personalized risk information for AD. The sum number correct of the two items that were presented to both randomization arms ("What form of APOE increases risk for Alzheimer's disease?", and "What percentage were you given as your 3-year risk of developing Alzheimer's disease?") are summarized here.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Participants who provided data on each scale.

outcomeMeasures.title: Participant Satisfaction
outcomeMeasures.description: How well participants' expectations about information, explanations, reassurance, advice, and help in decision making were met. Participants rated satisfaction for each dimension on a 1-7 scale, with higher scores indicating that expectations were met better.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Participants who provided responses on each expectation item

classes.title: Help in decision making: 6 Weeks Post-Disclosure

outcomeMeasures.title: User Ratings of Risk Assessment Experience
outcomeMeasures.description: Subjective ratings of the impact of risk assessment. Participants provided ratings on a 1-5 scale, with 1 being "very negative" and 5 being "very positive"
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Participants who completed these items in the post-disclosure surveys.

outcomeMeasures.title: Health Behavior and Insurance Changes
outcomeMeasures.description: AD prevention behaviors enacted within the prior two weeks.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Participants who provided data on health behaviors at each time point.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, 6 weeks post-disclosure, and 6 months post-disclosure

outcomeMeasures.title: Insurance and Advance Planning Changes
outcomeMeasures.description: A series of yes/no questions that ask whether the risk assessment motivated changes to insurance or advance planning.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Participants who provided data on the 6-month follow-up survey about these outcomes

outcomeMeasures.description: Yes/no response to the question, "Since receiving your Alzheimer's disease risk estimate, have you joined any other Alzheimer's disease-related research studies?"
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Participants who provided data on these survey items

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: From enrollment through 6 months after the Alzheimer's disease risk assessment.
adverseEventsModule.description: Non-serious adverse events were defined as scores at any time including baseline, on psychological outcome scales greater than or equal to 56 on the STAI (anxiety), 8 on the GDS (depression) or 2 on the BHS (hopelessness). Non-serious adverse events were identified at the judgment of study personnel as events that caused inconvenience or concern to participants, but did not qualify as serious. Serious adverse events were defined per guidelines from the National Institutes of Aging.

otherEvents.term: Increased monitoring due to high scores on anxiety, depression or hopelessness scales
otherEvents.notes: Scores at any time point of 56 or higher on the 6-item State-Trait Anxiety Index (STAI), 8 or higher on the 15-item Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS), and 2 or higher on the 4-item Beck Hopelessness Scale (BHS).
Extended delay of disclosure of Alzheimer's disease risk assessment

explanation_target: Reason: The trial (REVEAL IV) tests the impact of providing a genetic risk assessment (APOE genotype disclosure) to people with Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI) — i.e., it is an informational/genetic-disclosure intervention, not a pharmacologic or biologic therapy. citeturn0search1turn0search3

Act: Key extracted details — participants with MCI are randomized to receive a 3-year risk estimate that either includes APOE genotype results (genotype-disclosure arm) or excludes genotype (non-disclosure arm); the study measures psychological and behavioral outcomes after disclosure rather than testing a drug or biologic. The protocol and published REVEAL reports confirm APOE genotype disclosure and evaluation of communication/psychological effects. citeturn0search3turn0search9turn0search0

Reflect: Given the intervention (genetic risk disclosure/APOE testing) and aims (psychological, communication, and behavior outcomes; risk estimation of conversion to AD), the trial does not fit any of the four therapeutic categories (disease-targeted biologic, disease-targeted small molecule, cognitive enhancer, or neuropsychiatric symptom improvement). Therefore the correct classification is 'N/A'. This classification is supported by the trial description and REVEAL publications. citeturn0search1turn0search6

Web search results (sources used): (1) Project abstract describing REVEAL IV and its focus on APOE-based risk curves for MCI and randomized disclosure of genotype. citeturn0search1 (2) Roberts Research group summary of REVEAL IV, its aims, and randomized arms (genotype disclosure vs non-disclosure). citeturn0search3 (3) PubMed articles from the REVEAL program reporting disclosure outcomes and communication findings when APOE genotype is disclosed to MCI patients and companions. citeturn0search0turn0search6 (4) Clinical-trial summary showing study dates and that the intervention is genetic risk assessment (APOE) for MCI. citeturn0search9
